dsDescriptionValue.value: The Perceptions of Electoral Integrity-UK (PEI-UK V1.0) is based on an expert survey comparing the quality of elections in the May 2015 contest. Data was collected in for the UK and for England, Scotland and Wales. Almost 170 experts on UK elections were contacted, generating 68 responses, reflecting a response rate over 40%. The study was conducted by the Electoral Integrity Project. The Principle Investigators are Pippa Norris, Ferran Martinez i Coma, Alessandro Nai and Max Gromping, based at the University of Harvard and Sydney, with the assistance of Toby James and Alistair Clark. More details about the research design for this study can be found at www.electoralintegrityproject.com.

keywordValue.value: elections, electoral integrity, UK, electoral fraud, electoral integrity project, PEI, expert survey, voting behavior
